DataElement.preferredName: Child Patient Other Anesthetic Agent Use Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A human offspring (son or daughter) of any age; an immediate progeny._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._(an-es-THET-iks) Substances that cause loss of feeling or awareness. Local anesthetics cause loss of feeling in a part of the body. General anesthetics put the person to sleep._Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose._the free text field to specify the assessment performed.

Concepts.definition: A first-generation, biological descendant of any age.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A pharmacological agent that acts in a reversible fashion and can be applied either locally or systemically to cause a partial or total loss of sensation and pain or to induce unconsciousness.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/23/17 jk added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task; capitalized first word in definition. --- released

ReferenceDocuments.name: If sedation is needed, please
ReferenceDocuments.description: If sedation is needed, please specify what other agent is used if not Nitrous Oxide, oral sedation or a combination of the two for child patients in your practice, whether or not they have special needs?
